meanings.sent1: The denunciatory letter from the principal made the students feel guilty.
meanings.sent2: Her denunciatory remarks about the new policy were heard by everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The denunciatory tone of the cat scolding the dog for stealing its food was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The denunciatory clouds in the sky seemed to criticize the city below for its pollution.
meanings.sent5: The denunciatory look on her face made it clear she was not pleased with the situation.

meanings.definition: Serving to condemn or criticize harshly.
meanings.sent1: The denunciatory article in the newspaper exposed the corruption in the government.
meanings.sent2: His denunciatory speech at the rally called out the injustices in society.
meanings.sent3: The denunciatory review of the new restaurant made everyone laugh at its harshness.
meanings.sent4: The denunciatory sword of justice struck down the wrongdoers with swift condemnation.
meanings.sent5: The denunciatory tone of the judge's voice left no doubt about his disapproval of the defendant's actions.
